meanings.definition: An imaginary line dividing something into two equal halves.
meanings.sent1: The artist carefully drew the midline of the painting to ensure symmetry.
meanings.sent2: The midline of the road helps drivers stay in their lanes.
meanings.sent3: The cake was cut along the midline, creating perfectly equal slices for everyone.
meanings.sent4: The midline of the map divided the country into two distinct regions.
meanings.sent5: The midline of the ruler marked the exact center point.

meanings.definition: Situated in the middle of something.
meanings.sent1: The midline position of the chair made it easy to reach from all sides.
meanings.sent2: The midline seat at the movie theater provided the best view of the screen.
meanings.sent3: The midline table in the room was perfect for sharing snacks with friends.
meanings.sent4: The midline location of the house made it convenient for all family members.
meanings.sent5: The midline spot on the shelf was ideal for displaying the special vase.

meanings.definition: A line that runs down the center of the body, dividing it into left and right halves.
meanings.sent1: The surgeon carefully followed the midline during the operation to avoid any mistakes.
meanings.sent2: The midline of the body is crucial for maintaining balance and posture.
meanings.sent3: The yoga instructor emphasized the importance of aligning with the midline for proper form.
meanings.sent4: The dancer's movements were graceful as she stayed connected to her midline.
meanings.sent5: The athlete focused on strengthening the muscles along the midline for better performance.
